page.title: 02HUMSHAUGH EMPLOYMENT
page.content: THERE ARE NO CENTRES OF EMPLOYMENT IN THE VILLAGE. THUS, APART FROM SERVICE WORKERS, ALL COMMUTE DAILY TO HEXHAM, MORPETH OR NEWCASTLE. THE{OCCUPATIONS OF THE WORKING INHABITANTS VARY CONSIDERABLY; THE INDIGENOUS OCCUPA- TIONS INCLUDE FARM OR LAND OWNERS AND ESTATE WORKERS. {REDUNDANCY}IS CAUSING CONSTERNATION BECAUSE OF TRAVELLING DIFFICULTIES AND 'TIED HOUSES'. SOME INDIVIDUALS HAVE STARTED THEIR OWN CONTRACT FARMING BUSINESS AND 1 OR 2 WORK ABROAD. SEASONAL WORK IS UN- SATISFACTORY FOR THE BREADWINNER. THERE ARE MANY WOMEN WHO WORK FROM NECESSITY OR FROM CHOICE. THE VILLAGE HAS A NUMBER OF{RETIRED}PEOPLE INCLUD- ING SOME WHO HAVE TAKEN EARLY RETIRE- MENT. TOURISM IS AN EXPANDING SOURCE OF EMPLOYMENT OFFERING AN ALTERNATIVE TO SOME OF THE DECLINING TRADITIONAL FORMS OF VILLAGE WORK.
